files.description: GitHub Actions workflow that installs Python, runs the one-command runner (gate → validator → meta-analysis demo), fails if runtime/_build/reports or runtime/_build/tables are empty, and uploads runtime/_build/ as a build artifact.

files.description: Python CI entrypoint that executes the repository’s one-command runner, then validates that runtime/_build/reports and runtime/_build/tables exist and contain at least one non-dotfile, exiting nonzero on failure.

missionDescription: Create a minimal CI workflow that runs the one-command runner (gate → validator → meta-analysis demo) and uploads runtime/_build/ as CI artifacts; ensure CI fails if runtime/_build/reports or runtime/_build/tables are empty.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker
The recurring pattern is 'code exists but not executed'; CI turns execution into a guaranteed, repeatable gate and prevents regressions back to 0 outputs.
projectName: minimal CI workflow that runs the one-command runner (gate → validator → meta-analysis demo) and uploads runtime/_build/ as CI artifacts; ensure CI fails if runtime/_build/reports or runtime/_build/tables are empty.
